sn4.18:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling among the Magadhans at the brahmin village of Pañcasālā.
sn4.18:1.2: Now on that occasion the gift-festival of the young people was being held at the brahmin village of Pañcasālā.
sn4.18:1.3: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One dressed and, taking bowl and robe, entered Pañcasālā for alms.
sn4.18:1.4: Now on that occasion Māra the Evil One had taken possession of the brahmin householders of Pañcasālā,
sn4.18:1.5: [inciting in them the thought, ] “Don’t let the ascetic Gotama get alms. ”
sn4.18:2.1: Then the Blessed One left Pañcasālā with his bowl just as cleanly washed as it was when he entered it for alms.
sn4.18:2.2: Then Māra the Evil One approached the Blessed One and said to him:
sn4.18:2.4: “Was it you, Evil One, who saw to it that I didn’t get alms?”
sn4.18:2.5: “Then, venerable sir, let the Blessed One enter Pañcasālā a second time for alms.
sn4.18:2.6: I will see to it that the Blessed One gets alms. ”.
sn4.18:3.3: Do you really think, O Evil One,
sn4.18:4.2: We who own nothing at all.
sn4.18:4.3: We shall dwell feeding on rapture
sn4.18:4.4: Like the devas of Streaming Radiance. ”
sn4.18:5.1: Then Māra the Evil One … disappeared right there.
